item.title: Test Post
item.description: this is a post in which i’ll try out all kinds of stuff relating to hugo test quote (defun test (str) (declare ignore str) (print "Hello World")) let’s also add a heading It’s kinda impotant to know how those work embedding stuff (and also subheadings. note that this style doesn’t seem to distinguish between levels of subheadings.) tweets Adding an embedded tweet. https://twitter.com/einsiedlerspiel/status/1207715089224220672?s=20&t=ZFQCPYp2tQAQosb1f-vQXg Owl bet you'll lose this staring contest ðŸ¦‰ pic.
item.content:
this is a post in which i’ll try out all kinds of stuff relating to hugo

test quote

(defun test (str)
 (declare ignore str)
 (print "Hello World"))

let’s also add a heading

It’s kinda impotant to know how those work

embedding stuff

(and also subheadings. note that this style doesn’t seem to distinguish between levels of subheadings.)

tweets

Adding an embedded tweet.

https://twitter.com/einsiedlerspiel/status/1207715089224220672?s=20&t=ZFQCPYp2tQAQosb1f-vQXg

Owl bet you'll lose this staring contest ðŸ¦‰ pic.twitter.com/eJh4f2zncC

— San Diego Zoo Wildlife Alliance (@sandiegozoo) October 26, 2021

toots

Embedding toots is implemented via a custom shortcode

  • and more!

    as I’m writing this in org mode and export with ox-hugo 5* subehadeings become lists.

here’s a table

first second third
test test2 test3
test4

and a slightly different one

key value
1 2

lists

we’ve already seen that lists can be created with org header but org also has support for lists so how are those handled?

test 1

  • first
  • try
  • with

test 2

  • second
  • try
  • with +

test 3

  1. numbered
  2. lists
  3. are
  4. cool
